event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU), the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: The number of correctable errors detected within a SC chip has exceeded an acceptable threshold.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
The number of correctable errors detected within a SC chip has exceeded an acceptable threshold.


   SPARC Enterprise M3000 platform:

      The JSC chip replaces both the SC chip and the MAC chip.

      The type of fault can be determined from the "Affects:" FMRI in the fmdump output.
      The types of faults that can be detected are:

         -Internal to the JSC chip;
         -On the JSC chip's interface to an IO Channel;
         -On the JSC chip's interface to a CPU chip;
       
 
         Faults that are internal to the JSC chip:

            Domains will not be allowed to reboot and the platform will become unbootable.


         Faults that are on the JSC chip's interface to an IO Channel:
    
            Domain using the IO Channel is reset.
            IO Channel will be deconfigured after the domain is reset.
            Platform becomes unbootable.

            IO Channel 0 provides access to all internal I/O and PCI-Express slots 0, 1, 2, and 3.

             All IO on the platform is deconfigured and the platform becomes unbootable.


         Faults that are on the JSC chip's interface to a CPU chip:

            CPU chip will be deconfigured after the platform is power cycled or
            after the domain using the CPU chip reboots or
            after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.


 
 
   SPARC Enterprise M4000 platform:


      The type of fault can be determined from the "Affects:" FMRI in the fmdump output.
      The types of faults that can be detected are:

         -Internal to the SC chip;
         -On the SC chip's interface to an IO Channel;
         -On the SC chip's interface to a CPU chip;
         -On the SC chip's interface to a MAC chip;
         -On the SC chip's interface to a specific XSB.
 

         Faults that are internal to the SC chip:

            Domains will not be allowed to reboot and the platform will become unbootable.


         Faults that are on the SC chip's interface to an IO Channel:
    
            IO Channel will be deconfigured after the platform is power cycled or
            after the domain using the IO Channel reboots or
            after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.


               Availability of I/O devices depends on which IO Channel was deconfigured.
   
                  IO Channel 0 provides access to PCI-X slot 0, PCI-Express slots 1 and 2,
                  and all the internal I/O.

                  IO Channel 1 provides access to PCI-Express slots 3 and 4.


         Faults that are on the SC chip's interface to a CPU chip:

            CPU chip will be deconfigured after the platform is power cycled or
            after the domain using the CPU chip reboots or
            after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.


         Faults that are on the SC chip's interface to a MAC chip:
 
            8 DIMMs associated with the MAC chip will be deconfigured after the platform is power
            cycled or after the domain using the MAC chip reboots or
            after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.


         Faults that are on the SC chip's interface to an XSB:
   
            XSB will be deconfigured after the platform is power cycled or
            after the domain using the XSB reboots or
            after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.




   SPARC Enterprise M5000 platform:


      The type of fault can be determined from the "Affects:" FMRI in the fmdump output.
      The types of faults that can be detected are:

         -Internal to the SC chip;
         -On the SC chip's interface to an IO Channel;
         -On the SC chip's interface to a CPU chip;
         -On the SC chip's interface to a MAC chip;
         -On the SC chip's interface for a specific XSB.
 

         Faults that are internal to the SC chip:

            One-half of the Motherboard with the SC chip, along with its associated I/O,
            will be deconfigured, after the platform is power cycled or
            after the domains using the half of the Motherboard reboot or
            after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.

 
         Faults that are on the SC chip's interface to an IO Channel:
    
            IO Channel will be deconfigured after the platform is power cycled or
            after the domain using the IO channel reboots or
            after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.
 

               Availability of I/O devices depends on which IO Channel was deconfigured.
            
                  IO Channel 0 provides access to PCI-X slot 0, PCI-Express slots 1 and 2,
                  and all the internal I/O.

                     IOU#0: Internal I/O includes the DVD drive, the DAT drive, HDD#0 and HDD#1.
                     IOU#1: Internal I/O includes HDD#2 and HDD#3.

                  IO Channel 1 provides access to PCI-Express slots 3 and 4.


         Faults that are on the SC chip's interface to a CPU chip:

            CPU chip will be deconfigured after the platform is power cycled or
            after the domain using the CPU chip reboots or
            after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.


         Faults that are on the SC chip's interface to a MAC chip:
 
            8 DIMMs associated with the MAC chip will be deconfigured after the platform is power
            cycled or after the domain using the MAC chip reboots or
            after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.


         Faults that are on the SC chip's interface to an XSB:
   
            XSB will be deconfigured after the platform is power cycled or
            after the domain using the XSB reboots or
            after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.





   SPARC Enterprise M8000/M9000 platforms:


      The type of fault can be determined from the "Affects:" FMRI in the fmdump output.
      The types of faults that can be detected are:

         -Internal to the SC chip;
         -On the SC chip's interface to an IO Channel;
         -On the SC chip's interface to a CPU chip;
         -On the SC chip's interface to a MAC chip;
         -On the SC chip's interface for a specific XSB.


         Faults that are internal to the SC chip:

            CMU and all its associated I/O will be deconfigured after the platform is power cycled
            or  after the domains running on the CMU reboot or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration
            operation is performed.


         Faults that are on the SC chip's interface to an IO Channel:
    
            IO Channel will be deconfigured after the platform is power cycled or
            after the domain using the IO Channel reboots or
            after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.


               Availability of I/O devices depends on which IO Channel was deconfigured.

                  IO Channel 0 on IOC chip 0 provides access to PCI-Express slots 0,1 on this IOU.

                  IO Channel 1 on IOC chip 0 provides access to PCI-Express slots 2,3 on this IOU.

                  IO Channel 0 on IOC chip 1 provides access to PCI-Express slots 4,5 on this IOU.

                  IO Channel 1 on IOC chip 1 provides access to PCI-Express slots 6,7 on this IOU.


         Faults that are on the SC chip's interface to a CPU chip:

            CPU chip will be deconfigured after the platform is power cycled or
            after the domain using the CPU chip reboots or
            after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.


         Faults that are on the SC chip's interface to a MAC chip:
 
            16 DIMMs associated with the MAC chip will be deconfigured after the platform is power
            cycled or after the domains using the MAC chip reboot or
            after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.


         Faults that are on the SC chip's interface to an XSB:
   
            XSB will be deconfigured after the platform is power cycled or
            after the domain using the XSB reboots or
            after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.


The recommended service action for this event is to schedule the replacement of the affected FRU.

       LEGEND

      RED        = SUNW-MSG-ID
      BLUE     = EVENT_ID
      GREEN  = FRU


Step 1. Collect the fault message (use one of the following methods):


   Single-line fault message displayed on the XSCF console:

   Mar 20 21:45:19 san-ff2-21-0 fmd: SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12, CSN: 7860000772  
   EVENT-ID: 25495ed2-de55-45e6-be3e-450949285925
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8005-KQ for detailed information.


   Complete fault message using 'fmdump -m' on the XSCF console:

   MSG-ID: SCF-8005-KQ, TYPE: Fault, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Critical
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 20 21:45:19 UTC 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: 7860000772, HOSTNAME: san-ff2-21-0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: 25495ed2-de55-45e6-be3e-450949285925
   DESC: The number of correctable errors detected within a SC chip has exceeded an acceptable threshold.
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8005-KQ for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: Some resources associated with the SC chip (CPU chips, memory, IO Channels)
   will be deconfigured after the platform is power cycled or after the domain reboots or
   after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.
   The platform may become unbootable. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for   
   additional information.
   IMPACT: No immediate impact. Some resources associated with the SC chip (CPU chips, memory,
   IO Channels) will be deconfigured after the platform is power cycled or after the domain reboots or
   after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.  The platform may become unbootable.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
   REC-ACTION: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU),
   the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.


Step 2. Collect the output from the 'fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID' command


        xscf> fmdump -v -u 25495ed2-de55-45e6-be3e-450949285925

        TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
        Mar 20 21:45:19.3972 25495ed2-de55-45e6-be3e-450949285925 SCF-8005-KQ
          100%  fault.chassis.SPARC-Enterprise.asic.sc.ce

                Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/cmu=0/sc=0
                   Affects: hc:///chassis=0/cmu=0
                       FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=7860000772:
                            server-id=san-ff2-21-0:
                            part=CA20393-B50X 001AA:revision=0101/component=/MBU_B


Step 3. Contact your Authorized Service Provider.



If you require additional information, please refer to InfoDoc #87402.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: No immediate impact. Some resources associated with the SC chip (CPU chips, memory, IO Channels) will be deconfigured after the platform is power cycled or after the domain reboots or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed. The platform may become unbootable. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: Some resources associated with the SC chip (CPU chips, memory, IO Channels) will be deconfigured after the platform is power cycled or after the domain reboots or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed. The platform may become unbootable. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: Correctable errors detected within a SC chip have exceeded an acceptable threshold.
